column7: NEC LABORATORIES EUROPE GMBH,"The main ambition of Fed4IoT is to devise a platform for IoT virtualization offering to users different and isolated IoT systems (Virtual Silos) formed by on-demand Virtual Things. Virtual Things are generated by the integration and processing of data coming from a federated set of real things. Virtual Things can be IoT sensors and actuators.

column2: Fed4IoT is instead focused on offering Things-as-a-Service
column3: by acquiring (control of) an ever-growing number of devices out there in the field
column4: and by visualizing them to supply a scalable layer of horizontally share-able IoT resources to customers. Moreover
column5: the Virtual Things rented by a customer can be
column7: connected to upstream cloud service platforms as if they were real
column8: un-shared
column9: IoT devices. In this sense
column10: the Fed4IoT services are complementary to most of the existing solutions and can interoperate with them in an extended IoT chain.","Use cases designed and under implementation included integration of IoT devices for smart parking management

column16: Etaireia Eleytheroy Logismikoy Logismikoy Anoiktoy Kodika,The Digital Twin Data message streaming system lies at the core of the DUET T-cell and facilitates data streams between all components. The streaming features of the message streaming system allows  components to subscribe to data events. It also facilitates quick access to data in the case of responsive digital twin scenarios where data needs to be kept ready for use in models and/or visualizations. One of the most essential tasks of a digital twin system such as DUET is to enable the combination of different data sources to use them in (simulation) models or visualizations. More often than not
column17: data sources are not fully compliant with known standards. And even if they do

column20: integrating data sources from different suppliers remains non-trivial. column12: �Heerlens Heitje� through the European Regional Development Fund Urban Innovative Action (UIA) fund. Through the application
column13: citizens are being rewarded for undertaking public space maintenance tasks such as removing stickers from trash cans or weeding public gardens. The tasks that are included on the app are those which the government does not currently have sufficient funds to procure on a regular basis
column14: it is not intended to replace existing jobs of government employed maintenance workers and contractors. Citizens are paid in a local digital currency which they can use in Heerlen to help stimulate the local economy � See figure 15 for more information. Currently
column15: while still in the development stage
column16: the tasks are linked to addresses and GPS coordinates with photographs
column17: but the next step will be to integrate an embedded map.,,Risks: potential for oppression of job market - replace contracts of existing maintenance workers but steps put in place to avoid this
column18: project success contingent on uptake � must be willing to take on jobs city offers them,Co-delivery of public service enabled through app.,
